workflow.name: Daily AI research summary from arXiv with Gemini AI, Notion & Telegram alerts
workflow.description:
## What this template does

This workflow turns the arXiv AI feed into a daily research assistant.
Every morning it fetches the latest Artificial Intelligence papers from [arXiv.org](arXiv.org), deduplicates them, stores one page per paper in Notion (with metadata + PDF link), generates a **Deep Research Summary** of each PDF using Gemini, and finally posts a short update to a Telegram channel with links to both the paper and the Notion summary.

## Who is this for & what problem it solves

This template is designed for founders, researchers, builders and curious professionals who want to stay up-to-date with AI research without reading every paper in full.
It solves the ‚Äúinformation overload‚Äù problem: instead of manually checking arXiv and skimming PDFs, you get a curated daily feed with human-style explanations stored in your own Notion database.

## Use Cases

* Daily AI research digest for solo founders or small teams.
* Private ‚ÄúAI research hub‚Äù in Notion for your company or lab.
* Telegram channel that shares the latest AI papers plus plain-English summaries.
* Personal learning pipeline: track, tag and revisit important papers over time.

## How it works (workflow overview)

1. Scheduled trigger runs every day at 08:00.
2. HTTP Request pulls the latest AI papers from arXiv‚Äôs API.
3. Results are converted from XML to JSON and cleaned.
4. A time-window filter keeps only recent papers and removes duplicates.
5. For each paper, a Notion page is created (metadata + PDF URL).
6. Gemini reads the PDF and returns a structured, multi-chunk summary.
7. Each chunk is appended to the same Notion page as rich-text blocks.
8. A Telegram message is sent with title, short abstract, PDF link and Notion link.

## Setup (step-by-step)

1. Create a Notion database and connect your Notion integration.
2. Map the properties in the **Register to Notion Database** node (title, arxiv_id, abstract, authors, categories/tags, published date, pdf URL).
3. Add your Gemini API key and model in the **Analyze doc (Prompt Ultra-Pro)** node.
4. Add your Telegram bot token and **chat_id** in the **Send a text message** node.
5. (Optional) Adjust the arXiv query in **HTTP Request** to focus on your preferred AI categories or keywords.
6. Enable the **Scheduled Daily Trigger** when you‚Äôre ready to run it in production.

## Customization options

* Change the arXiv search query (keywords, categories, max_results).
* Modify the time window logic (e.g. 24h, 48h, or no filter).
* Adapt the Notion properties to your own schema (status, tags, priority, etc.).
* Switch the messaging channel (Telegram, Discord, Slack) using similar nodes.

parameters.content:
## 3. Result Splitter
Splitting feed results to separe items

## 3. Filter by last 24h
You can edit HOURS in the code if you need a wider window.

## 5. Register in Notion
* Filter fields before Notion
* Register to Notion
* Freeze **page_id** of each record
* Add subtitle **Deep Research Summary** inside new pages (will be used later)

## 10. Saving to Notion
Each chunk is saved, one by one, under the related paper according to their **page_id**

## 7. Generating and Saving a Deep Research Summary for each Paper
Processing every paper (full documents), one by one. Then generating a **Deep Research Summary** for each document and saving it to Notion. The **Deep Research Summary** provides a deeper analysis explaining paper's ideas and meanings clearly to curious professionals and non technical experts.

Contents Generated:
-> 1) 3‚Äì5 core insights; 2) Core idea and motivation ‚Äî explained simply; 3) Why this research matters now (context & importance); 4) Key innovations & contributions; 5) Method ‚Äî explained step-by-step in plain language; 6) Math / theory intuition (no formulas); 7) Experiments and evaluation ‚Äî what was tested and why it matters; 8) Key results & what they prove; 9) Limitations / where it may fail; 10) Real-world impact and applications; 11) Future work / open questions; 12) Closing takeaway ‚Äî 2-3 sentences summarizing the big picture

## 6. Send News to Telegram
Messages are sent as separate items, which include **title**, **authors**, **data** and **links** (including a link to Notion with **Deep Resume** we will be generating).

## 4. Result Cleaner
Dedupe results in case of repeated items and prepare clean fields for the next node

## 9. Splitting Output
The Output Data is too long to be saved to Notion, so is splitted into different chunks [<2000 characters], then debuged before saving

## 8. Generating Deep Research Summary
Each paper's pfd is analized to get a **Deep Research Summary**, and then **merge** the result with the related **page_id** to be saved to Notion.

## 2. Website Scraper
Scraping papers from [arXiv.org] filtered by **Artificial Intelligence** and then converting the results to JSON

## 1. Daily arXiv AI News Trigger
Executed daily at 8.00 am CET

link: https://arxiv.org/search/?query=Artificial+Intelligence&searchtype=all&source=header

assignments.name: abstract_clean
url_pdf

parameters.text:
You are an elite AI research analyst and science communicator.

Your task:
Deeply read and understand the attached research PDF and generate a structured, high-value explainer that will be stored inside a Notion child page.

Audience:
- Curious, intelligent founders and professionals
- Not technical experts, but can understand advanced concepts when clearly explained

Primary mission:
Explain the paper‚Äôs ideas, meaning, and significance ‚Äî NOT the metadata.
Do NOT repeat title, authors, arXiv ID, year, or publication info. We already store those separately.

Tone:
- Clear, sharp, human, insightful
- Like Karpathy + Paul Graham + Ali Abdaal
- No fluff, no hype, no academic filler
- Metaphors and intuitive explanations welcome
- Convey meaning and understanding, not jargon

CONTENT YOU MUST PRODUCE (as narrative with brief bold section headers inside text):

1) 3‚Äì5 core insights (executive brief)
2) Core idea and motivation ‚Äî explained simply
3) Why this research matters now (context & importance)
4) Key innovations & contributions
5) Method ‚Äî explained step-by-step in plain language
6) Math / theory intuition (no formulas ‚Äî explain what they *mean*)
7) Experiments and evaluation ‚Äî what was tested and why it matters
8) Key results & what they prove (plain English significance)
9) Limitations / where it may fail
10) Real-world impact and applications
11) Future work / open questions
12) Closing takeaway ‚Äî 2-3 sentences summarizing the big picture

Output rules:
- DO NOT repeat metadata (title, authors, arXiv ID, etc.)
- DO NOT output anything outside JSON
- NO chunk > 1900 characters
- NO markdown blocks, no backticks inside chunks
- Make the text feel like a human expert teaching

Return only valid JSON in this format:

{
  "chunks": [
    "chunk1 <= 1900 chars",
    "chunk2 <= 1900 chars",
    "...if needed"
  ]
}

Begin your analysis now.

parameters.content:
## 11. Wait and Start Over
After saving a paper's **Deep Research Summary**, wait and start over with remaining ones.

## Manual Trigger
Use this trigger to test the workflow

## Try It Out

### What this template does (end-to-end)
* Fetches new AI papers from arXiv.
* Filters by last 24h time window and de-duplicates papers.
* Creates a Notion database page per paper and stores key fields (+ the PDF link).
* Generates a plain-English **Deep Research** summary from the PDF (Gemini) and saves it as child blocks in the same Notion page.
* Posts a Telegram update at **08:00** with title + link(s) + a short abstract, including a link to the Deep Research in Notion.

### Run it now
* Click **Execute workflow** to test manually.
* When ready, enable the **Scheduled Trigger** (08:00 local by default).

### Configure these nodes (minimal)
* **HTTP Request** ‚Üí arXiv feed/query (e.g., your AI categories or keywords).
* **Filter by last 24h** -> you can edit HOURS in the code if you need a wider window.
* **Result Cleaner** ‚Üí keeps first occurrence of each `arxiv_id`.
* **Register in Notion**
  * Notion account (integration added to the target DB)
  * Database ID and property mapping (`name`, `url`, `abstract`, `authors`, `tags`, `pdf_url`, `arxiv_id`, `status`).
* **Freeze page_id** ‚Üí carries the created Notion `page_id` forward.
* **Analyze doc (Gemini)** ‚Üí set your model + API key (env var recommended).
* **Code (Parse Gemini JSON in chunks)** ‚Üí splits the model output into ‚â§1900-char slices.
* **Append chunks (Notion)** ‚Üí appends each slice under the same `page_id`.
* **Send to Telegram** ‚Üí bot token + `chat_id` (channel or group).

### What you‚Äôll see
* One Notion page per paper with metadata, PDF link, and a **Deep Research** section composed of multiple rich-text blocks.
* One Telegram post per paper with the Notion page link and the PDF.

### Notes & limits
* The summarizer reads the PDF and returns a structured explainer (core insights, method, results, limits, applications).
* Chunking ensures each block ‚â§1900 chars to avoid Notion/API errors.
* If you expect many items, keep **Wait** enabled to pace API calls.

### Requirements
* Notion integration with access to your target database.
* Telegram bot + channel/group `chat_id`.
* Gemini API key and model (e.g., `gemini-2.5-pro`).
* Optional: environment variables for secrets and IDs.

### Troubleshooting
* Empty summaries ‚Üí check PDF URL reachability and Gemini key/model.
* "Page not found" on append ‚Üí verify `page_id` is set before Append.
* Duplicates ‚Üí confirm `arxiv_id` exists and the dedupe node is before Notion create.
* Telegram not posting ‚Üí bot must be **admin** of the channel.
